page.title: 01Fenland SW of Kings Lynn
page.content:
The whole area is below sea level and drainage water is pumped up to rivers and sluices.
The land is uniformly flat and is alluvial plain overlying clay. There are magnificent skies with storm clouds seen for miles followed by dramatic sunsets.
The large fields, without hedges, are farmed by large farming groups and there are no small holders. The crops are cereals, sugar beet, and cabbage. No livestock. Wind blowing across the fen is a common feature.
The people are hard working, independent and resilient. Many are employed on the land but a proportion work in the nearby town of Kings Lynn.
